Package org.deeplearning4j.spark.time

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    TimeSource
    A time source is an abstraction of system time away from the local system clock.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    NTPTimeSource
    A TimeSource that utilize Network Time Protocol to determine the system clock offset
    Instances should be obtained via NTPTimeSource.getInstance() or TimeSourceProvider; one instance may be used per machine
    Specifically, the implementation uses Apache Commons Net (already a dependency in Spark) to query a NTP server.
    SystemClockTimeSource
    A TimeSource implementation that is identical to calling System.currentTimeMillis()
    TimeSourceProvider
    TimeSourceProvider: used to get a TimeSource via a static method.
    Defaults to the Network Time Protocol implementation NTPTimeSource, but can be switched to other implementations via the TimeSourceProvider.TIMESOURCE_CLASSNAME_PROPERTY system property.
